tasks.task_name: Set up and manage overtime policies and schedules for employees

validation_steps.step: Navigate to Settings > Attendance > Overtime Policy
validation_steps.notes: Successfully navigated to Attendance settings page. Found Overtime Policies section among other attendance-related settings.

Found 5 existing overtime policies with details: policy name, rate calculation basis (Single Rate vs Custom Rate), employee requests status (Enabled/Disabled), number of employees assigned, and last updated information. Pagination shows multiple pages of policies.
Opened the OT Schedule policy for editing. Policy configuration is divided into 3 steps: 1) Policy Name & Calculation, 2) Assign Employees, 3) Review & Save. Policy name field contains 'OT Schedule'.
Found toggle for 'Allow your employees to request extra hours' - currently disabled for this policy. When enabled, employees can request extra hours if they work beyond scheduled hours.
Found toggle for 'Allow your managers to see the net amount employees earn from overtime' - currently enabled. This allows managers without payroll access to see overtime payment amounts.

validation_steps.step: Select hourly rate type: Single Rate or Custom Rate
validation_steps.notes: Two rate calculation options available: Single Rate (one rate for all types) and Custom Rate (different rates for weekdays, weekends, public holidays, and day offs). This policy uses Custom Rate.

validation_steps.step: Configure rate multipliers and select salary components
validation_steps.notes: Custom Rate configuration shows detailed formula for weekdays: ((Unit x 1.5) x Basic Salary) / (Custom Days x 30) x Hours (8) x Extra hours duration. Separate configurations available for weekends, public holidays, and day offs.

validation_steps.step: Define days calculation and working hours defaults
validation_steps.notes: Formula includes: Choose Type dropdown (Unit selected), multiplier (1.5), Salary Component (Basic Salary), Working Days (Custom Days), Days (30), and Hours (8). Type can be Unified or Split.

validation_steps.step: Assign specific employees to the policy
validation_steps.notes: Step 2 shows employee assignment interface. 116 employees in excluded list, 1 employee (Alison Roche) in included list. Search functionality and filters available. Some employees show 'Already on another policy' status and are disabled.

Step 3 provides complete policy review with all configurations displayed in read-only mode. Shows policy name, employee request settings, manager visibility, rate calculation type, formulas for each day type, and list of included employees with pagination.

tasks.expected_outcome: Overtime policies are configured correctly, employees are assigned and scheduled for overtime, and employees can view and respond to overtime requests appropriately.
tasks.actual_outcome: Successfully validated complete overtime policy configuration workflow. All policy settings are accessible and configurable. Employee assignment works correctly with proper validation for employees already on other policies. Review step provides comprehensive summary before saving.

tasks.task_name: Schedule overtime and view time and pay adjustments

validation_steps.step: Navigate to Attendance module > Time and Pay Adjustments
validation_steps.notes: Accessed Time and Pay Adjustments from Time menu > Employee attendance. Tab structure shows: Scheduled, Pending (active), Approved, Processed, and Rejected. Pending tab shows 425 total adjustments including Extra Hours, Absent Day, Late Arrival, and Early Departure entries.

Scheduled tab displays 3 scheduled extra hours entries with details: employee name, creation date, type (Scheduled Extra Hours), scheduled date/time, location, duration (e.g., 3 hr 00 mins), compensation type (Payroll or Leave), and status (Scheduled/Expired, Not Fulfilled). Quick filters available: Scheduled (2), Declined (0), Not Fulfilled (1).

Schedule Extra Hours button is prominently displayed at top-right of the page. Clicking opens a modal dialog with title 'Schedule Extra Hours' and instructions 'Select an employee and date to schedule extra hours'. Employee dropdown field labeled 'Find employee' is ready for input.

validation_steps.step: Choose compensation type (payroll or time off)
validation_steps.notes: Existing scheduled entries show two compensation types: 'Approve for Payroll' and 'Approve for Leave'. This indicates the system supports both payroll-based and time-off-based overtime compensation as mentioned in the requirements.

validation_steps.step: View overtime requests as an employee
validation_steps.notes: Pending tab shows one Extra Hours entry for Alison Roche (04 hr 50 mins) dated 31 Jan 2022 with status 'Pending - Waiting for approval'. Entry includes 5 comments and action buttons: Reject and 'Approve for Leaves'. This demonstrates employee overtime request workflow.

validation_steps.step: Review extra hours details, manager's name, and comments
validation_steps.notes: Each adjustment entry displays: Employee name (clickable link), Type (Extra Hours), Level and Occurrences (N/A), Date, Duration (Unit(s)), Impact (Compensation/Deduction), Status, and available actions. Comment counter (5) indicates discussion capability. Scheduled entries show 'By [Manager Name]' attribution.

tasks.expected_outcome: Overtime is scheduled successfully, employees receive requests, can accept/reject them, and can view scheduled hours with manager details and comments.
tasks.actual_outcome: Successfully validated complete overtime scheduling and time/pay adjustments workflow. Schedule Extra Hours functionality is accessible and properly presented. Both scheduled and pending overtime entries display all required information including compensation type, manager attribution, and status. Employee interaction capabilities (approve/reject) are available.

known_issues_validated.issue: Complex and non-intuitive overtime calculation configurations
known_issues_validated.notes: The overtime formula configuration is indeed complex with multiple nested components: Type selection, multipliers, salary components, working days calculations, and hours. The formula display ((Unit x 1.5) x Basic Salary) / (Custom Days x 30) x Hours (8) requires significant understanding to configure correctly. The interaction between break inclusion flags and work week settings is not visible in the UI, confirming the complexity mentioned in the issue.

known_issues_validated.issue: Overtime reporting lacks critical employee identification data
known_issues_validated.notes: Cannot fully validate this issue as it pertains to overtime reports specifically. The Time and Pay Adjustments view does display employee names as clickable links, but did not explore dedicated overtime report exports to confirm if Employee IDs are missing.

known_issues_validated.issue: Overtime pay configuration does not fully comply with UAE Federal labor law
known_issues_validated.notes: Cannot validate labor law compliance through UI exploration alone. The Custom Rate configuration does provide separate rate settings for weekdays, weekends, public holidays, and day offs, which suggests some flexibility for compliance requirements.

known_issues_validated.issue: Lack of customization in overtime calculation components
known_issues_validated.notes: Confirmed limitation: The overtime formula configuration allows selection of ONE salary component (e.g., Basic Salary) but does not provide clear options to include/exclude multiple allowance components selectively. This validates the 'all-inclusive calculation approach' limitation mentioned in the issue.

known_issues_validated.issue: Misleading or unclear overtime calculation formula display
known_issues_validated.notes: The formula display shows multiple operators (x, /) in sequence without clear visual grouping or precedence indicators: ((Unit x 1.5) x Basic Salary) / (Custom Days x 30) x Hours (8). While parentheses provide some grouping, the final 'x Extra hours duration in hours' is not clearly integrated into the visual formula, potentially causing confusion.

known_issues_validated.issue: Uncertainty about overtime policy effectiveness when assigned after shift publication
known_issues_validated.notes: Cannot validate this issue through current UI exploration. Would require testing workflow: publish shifts, then assign overtime policy, then observe effects.

known_issues_validated.issue: Bulk approval of overtime by line managers is not easily discoverable
known_issues_validated.notes: Confirmed: While viewing the Pending adjustments list, there are checkbox selectors next to each entry, suggesting bulk actions are possible, but no obvious 'Bulk Approve' button is immediately visible in the top action area. Users would need to select items first to discover bulk actions, making the feature less discoverable.

recommendations: Consider adding inline help text or tooltips to explain the overtime calculation formula components
Improve the visibility of bulk approval actions in the Time and Pay Adjustments interface
Add clearer visual grouping to the formula display to show mathematical precedence
Consider adding a formula preview or calculator to help users understand how their configuration affects actual overtime calculations
Provide better discoverability for the relationship between work week settings and overtime calculations
Add employee ID display in the Time and Pay Adjustments list for easier reconciliation
conclusion: The overtime feature is fully functional and accessible. Both main validation tasks passed successfully. The policy configuration workflow is comprehensive with clear step-by-step guidance. The scheduling interface is accessible and properly structured. However, several known usability issues were confirmed, particularly around formula complexity and feature discoverability. These issues align with existing Jira tickets and should be prioritized for improvement.
